DataElement.preferredName: Invasive Carcinoma Negation Molecular Genetic Variation Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the presence of invasive cancer that does not harbor genetic abnormalities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Invasive Carcinoma Negation Molecular Genetic Variation Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that is not confined to the epithelium, and has spread to the surrounding stroma._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Irregularity in either the expression or sequence of a Gene in diseased versus normal tissue sources. (NCICB)_Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Any alteration in the inherited nucleic acid sequence of the genotype of an organism.

Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
